channel.title: A couple of helpful github links
channel.description:
While perusing through twitter for the latest security news as per usual, I came across two github links that I believe may be helpful to some people.
1.) [Mimipenguin](https://github.com/huntergregal/mimipenguin): A tool to dump the login password from the current linux desktop user. Adapted after the idea behind the popular Windows tool mimikatz.
2.) [libfuzzer-workshop](https://github.com/Dor1s/libfuzzer-workshop): Repository for materials of "Modern fuzzing of C/C++ Projects" workshop.
I've not yet had a chance to check out either of these projects in full due to time constraints for a school project, but I figured you guys and gals would like them. If you do try them (or just one of them), please do comment as to what you think about them!
